properties.name: 38th St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This entrance can be hard to find if you\'ve never entered this way, before. You turn off of 38th Ave onto Simms Ct, follow that all the way to the end and turn right and immediately park. The entrance will be on your left. A large sign stands next to the entrance. It\'s a small path that leads down into the Greenbelt, where the path starts it runs between two houses on Simms St. This is a great night-time entrance if you\'re quiet and quick. Take care to not make too much noise, we wouldn\'t want the people who live here to complain to the city, now would we? The path takes you down a hill. When you get to the very bottom there will be a wooden walkway. Take the right fork (the left one has been closed for years) and follow it. You\'ll end up following the path through some vegetation and you\'ll come out across the trail from Prospect park.

properties.name: 41st Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This entrance is off of Kipling, you take 41st Ave west to get to it. This marker is right at the top of a small hill where the road forks. Stay to the right and you\'ll descend from the top of the hill into a parking area. All that is at this entrance is the parking area, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain. Police come through the parking lot somewhat regularly at night so it\'s sort of an ok night-time entrance if you\'re walking. You do not have to go through the parking are to continue along the Greenbelt. At the back of the parking area you\'ll see a couple of forks in the path. There used to be an area north of the parking area where lots of people would go 4-wheeling and get their trucks stuck. That\'s all been flattened out and sort of blocked off.

properties.name: 42nd Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa There are two paths into the Greenbest on this street, with the easternmost path being wider and more noticeable than the westernmost path. No regular police patrols beyond looking for cars parked on 42nd, a good night-time entrance. No normal parking, no rest room, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: 43rd Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa The best way to get to this entrance is to come off of 44th on to Tabor St and go around to the rear of the Newgate apartments and park in there. There usually aren\'t police around here, but they do have to go to the apartments from time to time. Once you come around the bend and off of Tabor (or if you\'re coming off of Kipling and the road starts that first curve) you can get in just about anywhere along the street. There are 3 entrances with paths, but you can walk through the bushes, too. No parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain. This is a good night-time entrance.

properties.name: 44th Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa There are entrances on both the northern and southern sides of 44th, both are west of the bridge. This is a decent night entrance if you\'re walking as there is no parking, but police regularly patrol 44th. No parking, no rest room, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: 46th Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is a good night-time entrance. You can park pretty much anywhere along the street. Police don\'t regularly patrol this street. Be considerate of the people who live in the area. No real parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: 48th Ave entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa To reach this entrance, take the road that Otis leads into as you cross 48th heading north. The road goes down past (whatever the swedish place is, edit this) and into the parking area. This is a good night-time entrance if you\'re walking as police check the parking area semi-regularly. Good parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Anderson Park drinking fountain
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Anderson Park picnic area 1
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Anderson Park picnic area 2
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Anderson Park picnic area 2
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa To get into Anderson park, go south on Field St from 44th Ave. At Anderson you\'ll find a skate park, a baseball field, a soccer field, a public swimming pool, a picnic area, a rest room and a drinking fountain. Police are in the park at night pretty regularly, both driving through and just sitting. This is a decent night entrance if you\'re walking, and bad one if you\'re driving.

properties.name: Anderson Park rest room
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Hoyt Ct entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is a good night-time entrance, you can just park anywhere around te cul-de-sac. Be polite if you park around or walk to this entrance, the people who live around the cul-de-sac don\'t mind people, but they hate hoodlums. No real parking areas, no rest roooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Hoyt St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is a good night-time entrance. You can park anywhere along the street, just be considerate of the people who live along the street. No real parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Independence Ct entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa Just follow Independence Ct. north all the way to the end and you\'ll see a path leading into the Greenbelt. This is a good night-time entrance. Police don\'t usually sit around here but, as it\'s right next to Everitt Middle, people tend to call the police if you park too near the entrance and are seen going in at night. Park a few blocks away ;)

properties.name: Iris St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is a good night-time entrance. You can park pretty much anywhere around here, but you might want to park near the houses because even though police don\'t usually sit here, they will patrol through from time to time looking for cars parked along 42nd Ave. No real parking areas (plenty of street, though), no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Johnson Park drinking fountain
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Johnson Park entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa You can only enter Johnson park from southbound Wadsworth, there is a median so you can\'t enter if you\'re heading north. This is not a good night entrance, police sit in the parking area semi-regularly. There are rest rooms, a drinking fountain, a playground, a picnic area and a pond at Johnson park. The Greenbelt path runs along the northern border of the park.

properties.name: Johnson Park picnic area
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Johnson Park rest room
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Kipling St entrace
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa There are entrances on both sides of Kipling, just north of the creek. The entrance on the west side of Kipling is just a path that leads right up to the sidewalk, so it\'s not a good night-time entrance. The entrance on the east side of Kipling is in a little park (edit this) with a small amount of parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain. Police usually sit here so this is also not a good night-time entrance.

properties.name: Marshall St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This entrance is right on Marshall St, so it\'s a good night-time entrance if you\'re walking. There is some parking in the parking lot of the business by the entrance, just try to not encroach on their lot too much. No real parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Parfet St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa Just come off of 44th and go down Tabor St and park somewhere before the houses end. Police don\'t sit around here very regularly. If you park in front of a house, it might be a good idea to get in kinda quickly. No real parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain. Decent night-time entrance, but not the best.

properties.name: Prospect Park drinking fountain
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Prospect Park entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is the Prospect park entrance, off of 44th Ave. You follow this entrance road south and west around the bottom of Prospect lake. This entrance is loaded; rest rooms, drinking fountains, picnic areas, barbecues, a playground and a couple of baseball fields. The actual Greenbelt entrance is all the way at the southern part of Prospect park. Watch out, police like to sit at the picnic area at night, usually doing paperwork.

properties.name: Prospect Park picnic area
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Prospect Park rest rooms
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Wadsworth Blvd entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This entrance is a good night-time entrance if you\'re walking, as there aren\'t any places to park along the onramp...speaking of which, BE CAREFUL here, the entrance is along the side of a highway onramp and all sidewalks to this entrance are near very busy roadways. Follow the path around to some stairs that will take you down into the Greenbelt. No parking, no rest rooms, no drinking fountain.

properties.name: Youngfield St drinking fountain
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa

properties.name: Youngfield St entrance
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa This is the Youngfield St entrance. At this entrace you\'ll find a nice-sized parking lot, a drinking fountain and rest rooms. Police sometimes sit at the entrance at night (mostly in a white Jeep Cherokee), clocking people driving along Youngfield. Not a reliable night-time entrance.

properties.name: Youngfield St rest rooms
properties.description: Posted by Jeffwa
